Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fool \Fool\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Fooled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Fooling}.] To play the fool; to trifle; to toy; to spend time in idle sport or mirth. [1913 Webster]
Is this a time for fooling? --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
fooling adj : characterized by a feeling of irresponsibility; "a broken back is nothing to be casual about; it is no fooling matter" [syn: {casual}]
